member.name: M:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MiscUtils.DeepClone``1(``0)
member.summary: Perform a blind deep copy of an object. The class must be marked as [Serializable] in order for this to work. There are many ways to do this: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/129389/how-do-you-do-a-deep-copy-an-object-in-net-c-specifically/11308879 The binary serialization is apparently slower but safer. Feel free to reimplement with a better way.

member.name: T:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx
member.summary: The win multimedia timer is erratic. This class attempts to reduce the error by running at one msec and managing the requested periods manually. This is accomplished by using a Stopwatch to actually measure the elapsed time rather than trust the mm timer period. It seems to be an improvement. Also see "Microsecond and Millisecond C# Timer - CodeProject.html". Good accuracy at the expense of a whole core.

member.name: F:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx.TimerInstance.period
member.summary: The time between events in msec.

member.name: F:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx._timers
member.summary: All the timer instances. Key is id.

member.name: F:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx._running
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the timer is running.

member.name: F:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx._disposed
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the timer has been disposed.

member.name: E:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx.TimerElapsedEvent
member.summary: Occurs when the time period has elapsed.

member.name: F:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx._resolution
member.summary: Timer resolution in milliseconds. The resolution increases with smaller values - a resolution of 0 indicates periodic events should occur with the greatest possible accuracy. To reduce system overhead, however, you should use the maximum value appropriate for your application.

member.name: T:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx.TimeProc
member.summary: Called by Windows when a mm timer event occurs.

member.name: F:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx._timeProc
member.summary: Called by Windows when a mm timer event occurs.

member.name: M:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx.timeSetEvent(System.Int32,System.Int32,NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx.TimeProc,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.param: Event delay, in milliseconds.If this value is not in the range of the minimum and maximum event delays supported by the timer, the function returns an error.

Resolution of the timer event, in milliseconds. The resolution increases with smaller values; a resolution of 0 indicates periodic events should occur with the greatest possible accuracy. To reduce system overhead, however, you should use the maximum value appropriate for your application.
Pointer to a callback function that is called once upon expiration of a single event or periodically upon expiration of periodic events.

member.name: M:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Timer class.

member.name: M:NBagOfTricks.Utils.MmTimerEx.MmTimerCallback(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Multimedia timer callback. Don't trust the accuracy of the mm timer so measure actual using a stopwatch.
member.param: The identifier of the timer. The identifier is returned by the timeSetEvent function.
The value that was specified for the dwUser parameter of the timeSetEvent function.

member.summary: Represents information about the multimedia timer capabilities.

member.name: T:NBagOfTricks.StateMachine.SmEngine
member.summary: A generalized implementation of a state machine.
member.remarks:
States: - Each state must have a name, except the (optional) default state identified by null. The default state is checked first, then the current state. - Each state must have one or more Transitions. - Each state may have an enter and/or exit action executed on state changes.
Transitions: - Each transition must have an event name, except the (optional) default transition identified by null. If a transition for the event name is not found, the default transition is executed. - Each transition may have a next state name otherwise stays in the same state. - Each transition may have a transition action.

member.name: F:NBagOfTricks.StateMachine.SmEngine._processingEvents
member.summary: Flag to handle recursion in event processing.

member.name: M:NBagOfTricks.StateMachine.SmEngine.Init(NBagOfTricks.StateMachine.State[],System.String)
member.summary: Init everything. Also does validation of the definitions at the same time.

member.name: M:NBagOfTricks.StateMachine.SmEngine.ProcessEvent(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Processes an event. Returns when event queue is empty. Events can be coming on different threads so this method is locked.

member.name: M:NBagOfTricks.StateMachine.SmEngine.GenerateDot
member.returns: Returns a string that contains the DOT markup.

member.name: P:NBagOfTricks.StateMachine.State.Transitions
member.summary: All the transitions possible for this state.

member.summary: Convenience reference to optional default transition.

member.param: Collection of transitions for this state

member.summary: Initialize the state and its transitions.

member.summary: Enter the state by executing the enter action
